intro: Iriartea stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit puya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, showy inflorescence composed of numerous white or pale green flowers. Its leaves are usually broad and leathery, providing structural support and aiding in photosynthesis. Iriartea stenocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and unique growth habits.
